passage.text: Encouraging good antimicrobial prescribing practice: A review of antibiotic prescribing policies used in the South East Region of England
Policies varied greatly in content and quality, there was no clear evidence of effectiveness, and policies must be revised to align with current recommendations.

Despite the increasing understanding of osteoclast's role in bone resorption, there is still not enough information about how these cells are formed. The most significant finding is that the anti-resorbing agent 17-estradiol has been associated with reduced morphology and the disappearance of marrow in mice treated with estrogen.

The significance of using functional and structural approaches to understand molecular interactions is highlighted by the fact that some contacts in the x-ray structure of the MS2 RNA-protein complex are significantly absent, while others remain significant. Figure 4 illustrates the important interactions at A-4 and A-10, including Val29 and Lys61.
